snippet: That term dates back to the 1950s and worries over legal claims.
abstract: Editorial submits term 'student-athlete,' much discussed in course of O'Bannon case, is deceptive one with peculiar history; notes term was created in 1950s to protect colleges from paying players as if they were employees; holds description, with its implication that athletics come second to academics, should not apply equally to all college athletes.
lead_paragraph: That term dates back to the 1950s and worries over legal claims.

headline.print_headline: The Myth of the ‘Student-Athlete’ Is Laid to Rest
